intro: Jamesonia tolimensis, commonly known as the Tolima Jamesonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with dense, leathery foliage. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
